author: Sunitha Sekar
text:
Courier counters in Delhi stations trigger idea

In the future, commuters of Chennai Metro Rail may be able to collect their parcels from e-commerce sites at the stations itself.

Officials of Chennai Metro Rail Limited (CMRL) said they were considering setting up counters for e-commerce sites at the stations, as part of property development plans.

“We found that the idea of having courier counters will be happening soon in Delhi Metro Rail stations and hence we too have considered this plan. It will definitely be part of our stations but this may take some more time here,” an official said.

They noted that this might be implemented in a full-fledged way once the entire 45-km stretch of the Chennai Metro Rail service became operational.

“It would make sense to have it when the operations begin in a full swing. This would also attract more commuters to our stations, which will enhance safety,” he added.

The first Metro Rail service between Koyambedu and Alandur, a distance of 10 km, was commissioned only in July last.

In a few months, the next stretch from Little Mount to Chennai airport may also be launched.

The initiative is expected to attract more commuters to stations, in turn enhancing safety
title: E-commerce pickup points at Metro likely
